newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Rouble firm on arbitrage, ahead T-bill sales.
newsitem.headline: Rouble firm on arbitrage, ahead T-bill sales.

text.p: The rouble was stable against the dollar but overnight credit rates firmed ahead of Wednesday's government bond auctions and on arbitrage operations, dealers said.
"Roubles are scarce ahead of the auctions, this is why the dollar is not rising at the moment," Moscow Business World Bank dealer Nikolai Zolotaryov said.
On Wednesday October 23, the central bank is auctioning eight trillion roubles of six-month GKO T-bills and 2.5 trillion roubles of two-year OFZ bonds.

Another dealer said relatively high overnight rates had made it attractive to carry out a swap, selling dollars for today settlement and buying them back for tomorrow settlement, while investing the rouble proceeds on the overnight credit market.

Roubles for today settlement were quoted at 5.431-34 per dollar, the same as in early trading. They were at 5.434-36 late on Monday. Tomorrow roubles were unchanged from yesterday's late 5.437-40 per dollar.
The central bank said it had set 5.435/5.445 as its bid and offer rates against the dollar on Monday.
Overnight rouble credits yielded 40-50 percent compared with Monday's late 20-30 percent.
